official-title.#text: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for increased supervision of persons required to wear an electronic monitoring device as a condition of release from prison, to criminalize disabling such an electronic monitoring device, to establish the Office of the Inspector General for Probation and Pretrial Services, and for other purposes.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of the Inspector General for Probation and Pretrial Services

text.#text: With respect to probation and pretrial services, the
conduct investigations of alleged misconduct;
conduct and supervise audits and investigations;
prevent and detect waste, fraud, and abuse; and
recommend changes in laws or regulations governing probation and pretrial services.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of the Inspector General for Probation and Pretrial Services
Office of the Inspector General for Probation and Pretrial Services

text.#text: In carrying out the duties of the
to make investigations and reports;

to obtain information or assistance from any Federal, State, or local governmental agency, or other entity, or unit thereof, including all information kept in the normal course of business by probation and pretrial services in any judicial district;

to require, by subpoena or otherwise, the attendance and testimony of such witnesses, and the production of such books, records, correspondence memoranda, papers, and documents; which subpoena, in the case of contumacy or refusal to obey, shall be enforceable by civil action;
to administer to or take from any person an oath, affirmation, or affidavit;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , governing appointments in the competitive service, and the provisions of
relating to classification and General Schedule pay rates;
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: subchapter III of chapter 53 of such title

text.#text: to employ such officers and employees, subject to the provisions of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: at daily rates not to exceed the equivalent rate prescribed for grade GS–18 of the General Schedule by

text.#text: to obtain services authorized by

to the extent and in such amounts as may be provided in advance by appropriations Acts, to enter into contracts and other arrangements for audits, studies, analyses, and other services with public agencies and with private persons, and to make such payments as may be necessary to carry out the duties of the Office.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not have the authority to—

investigate or review any matter that is directly related to the merits of a decision or procedural ruling by any judge or court; or
punish or discipline any pretrial services officer or probation officer.

text.#text: No officer, employee, agent, contractor, or subcontractor of pretrial services may discharge, demote, threaten, suspend, harass, or in any other manner discriminate against an employee in the terms and conditions of employment because of any lawful act done by the employee to provide information, cause information to be provided, or otherwise assist in an investigation regarding any possible violation of Federal law or regulation, or misconduct, by a pretrial services officer or probation officer, which may assist the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may, in a civil action, obtain appropriate relief.
